column1: 1 ^ Fundamènta ejus in mòntibus sanctîs~; ^ The foundations thereof are the holy mountains.
2 ^ díliģit Dòminus portas Siónis super òmnia tabernácula Jacóbis. ^ The Lord loveth the gates of Sion above all the tabernacles of Jacob.

column2: cívitas Dei. ^ Glorious things are said of thee

column1: 4 ^ Mèmor èro Rahábis et Babilónis scièntium me. Ecce alieníģenaĕ et Tirus et pòpulus Aetiópum
column2: hi fuérunt illic. ^ I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me. Behold the foreigners and Tyre and the people of the Ethiopians
«~Hòmo et hòmo natus est in ea
column3: et ìpse fundávit eam Altìssimus~»~? ^ Shall not Sion say
column4: "This man and that man is born in her
column5: and the Highest himself hath founded her"~?

column1: 6 ^ Dòminus narrábit in scriptúrîs populórum et princìpium
column2: horum qŭi fuérunt in ea. ^ The Lord shall tell in his writings of peoples and of princes
column3: of them that have been in her.

column1: 7 ^ sicut laĕtántium òmnium habitáțio est in te. ^ The dwelling in thee is as it were of all rejoicing.
